arm_group.description: mobile device for virtual reality program

brief_summary.textblock:
Using the upper extremity rehabilitation program developed by virtual reality would help the
      recovery upper extremity function in patients with stroke.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Development of Upper Extremity Rehabilitation Program Using Virtual Reality for the Stroke Patients
clinical_study.condition: Upper Extremity Dysfunction After the Stroke

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke confirmed by brain imaging study

          -  upper extremity dysfunction

          -  possible to use a simple device

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  delirium, confusion or other evidence related to the consciousness

          -  uncontrolled medical or surgical disease

          -  unable to command to the order due to severe cognitive impairment

          -  visual impairment

          -  unable to sit

intervention.intervention_name: Virtual reality program for upper extremity rehabilitation

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline(just before beginning the treatment), at the end of the treatment for 2 weeks, 1 month later of the end of the treatment for 2 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline(just before beginning the treatment), at the end of the treatment for 2 weeks, 1 month later of the end of the treatment for 2 weeks
baseline(just before beginning the treatment), at the end of the treatment for 2 weeks, 1 month later of the end of the treatment for 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Research Council (MRC) Scale for Muscle Strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline(just before beginning the treatment), at the end of the treatment for 2 weeks, 1 month later of the end of the treatment for 2 weeks
baseline(just before beginning the treatment), at the end of the treatment for 2 weeks, 1 month later of the end of the treatment for 2 weeks
everytime when the patient uses program (automatically all recorded)
at the end of the treatment for 2 weeks

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
